input.kitchenTools:
Pans: 6 quart dutch oven, 12 inch stainless steel skillet, 7.5 inch stainless steel skillet, stainless steel stockpot, stainless steel sauce pan.

Kitchen Tools: Knives, garlic press, can opener.
input.cookingNotes: I prefer meals that can be made with 1-2 pans and take around an hour to cook. I am also okay with meals that are simple to prepare but need to simmer all day in my dutch oven or crockpot for example.

meals.title: Chicken Tacos
meals.instructions: Season chicken breast with taco seasoning and cook in a skillet over medium heat for 20 minutes until cooked through. Warm tortillas in a separate pan. Serve chicken in tortillas with diced bell peppers and onions.

meals.title: Black Bean Salad
meals.instructions: Combine black beans, diced bell peppers, onion, and avocado in a bowl. Drizzle with lime juice and toss to combine. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

meals.title: One-Pan Chicken and Rice
meals.instructions: In a dutch oven, sauté onion and garlic until fragrant. Add chicken, brown rice, and chicken broth. Simmer for 30 minutes until rice is tender and chicken is cooked through.

meals.title: Breakfast Fried Rice
meals.instructions: In a skillet, sauté diced carrots and broccoli until tender. Add cooked rice and soy sauce, stir-fry for 5 minutes. Push to the side and scramble eggs in the same pan.

meals.title: Turkey Stir-Fry
meals.instructions: In a skillet, cook ground turkey until browned. Add bell peppers, onion, and ginger, stir-fry for 10 minutes. Serve with rice or noodles.

meals.title: Coconut Curry Salmon
meals.instructions: In a skillet, combine coconut milk and curry powder, simmer for 5 minutes. Add salmon fillets and cook for 10-12 minutes until flaky. Serve with rice.

meals.title: Spinach and Cheese Omelette
meals.instructions: Whisk eggs and pour into a hot skillet. Add spinach and cheese, cook until set. Fold and serve warm.

meals.title: Cucumber Avocado Salad
meals.instructions: Slice cucumber and avocado, toss with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Serve chilled as a refreshing side.

meals.title: Pasta Primavera
meals.instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. In a skillet, sauté seasonal vegetables until tender, then toss with pasta and parmesan cheese.

meals.title: Overnight Oats
meals.instructions: Combine oats, milk, and yogurt in a jar. Add toppings like fruit or nuts, and refrigerate overnight. Enjoy cold in the morning.

meals.title: Chicken Fried Rice
meals.instructions: In a skillet, cook diced chicken until browned. Add cooked rice, soy sauce, and vegetables, stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until heated through.

meals.title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
meals.instructions: Hollow out bell peppers and fill with a mixture of cooked rice, black beans, and spices. Bake in the oven at 375°F for 25-30 minutes.

meals.title: Greek Yogurt with Fruit
meals.instructions: Serve Greek yogurt in a bowl topped with sliced fruits and a drizzle of honey. Enjoy as a quick breakfast.

meals.title: Teriyaki Chicken
meals.instructions: Marinate chicken in teriyaki sauce, then grill or pan-sear until cooked through. Serve with steamed broccoli and rice.

meals.title: Vegetable Curry
meals.instructions: Sauté onion and garlic, add mixed vegetables and curry powder, then stir in coconut milk. Simmer for 20 minutes and serve with rice.

meals.title: Avocado Toast
meals.instructions: Mash avocado on toasted bread, season with salt and pepper, and top with sliced tomatoes. Serve immediately.

meals.title: Asian Chicken Salad
meals.instructions: Combine shredded chicken, mixed greens, and sesame dressing. Toss to combine and serve chilled.

meals.title: Pasta with Garlic and Olive Oil
meals.instructions: Cook pasta, then sauté garlic in olive oil. Toss cooked pasta with garlic oil and parsley, serve warm.

meals.title: Smoothie Bowl
meals.instructions: Blend yogurt, banana, and spinach, pour into a bowl, and top with granola and fruit. Enjoy cold.

meals.title: Quinoa and Black Bean Bowl
meals.instructions: Mix cooked quinoa with black beans, corn, and diced avocado. Drizzle with lime juice and serve.

meals.title: Baked Salmon with Lemon
meals.instructions: Season salmon with lemon and herbs, bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes. Serve with steamed vegetables.

input.kitchenTools:
Pans: 6 quart dutch oven, 12 inch stainless steel skillet, 7.5 inch stainless steel skillet, stainless steel stockpot, stainless steel sauce pan.

Kitchen Tools: Knives, garlic press, can opener.
input.cookingNotes: I prefer meals that can be made with 1-2 pans and take around an hour to cook. I am also okay with meals that are simple to prepare but need to simmer all day in my dutch oven or crockpot for example.

meals.title: Breakfast Burrito
meals.instructions: Scramble 2 eggs with spinach and diced bell peppers in a skillet. Place mixture in a tortilla, add cheese, and roll it up. Serve with salsa if desired.

meals.title: Chicken & Black Bean Bowl
meals.instructions: Cook brown rice in a rice cooker. In a skillet, sauté onions, garlic, and bell peppers. Add cooked chicken and black beans, season with taco seasoning, and serve over rice.

meals.title: Mexican Chicken Soup
meals.instructions: In a dutch oven, combine chicken broth, diced tomatoes, black beans, and cooked chicken. Simmer for 30 minutes, season with cumin, and serve hot.

meals.title: Veggie Omelette
meals.instructions: Whisk 2 eggs and pour into a heated skillet. Add chopped onions, bell peppers, and spinach. Cook until set, fold, and serve with toast.

meals.title: Teriyaki Turkey Stir-Fry
meals.instructions: In a skillet, cook ground turkey until browned. Add broccoli, carrots, and soy sauce. Stir-fry until veggies are tender and serve over rice.

meals.title: Pasta Primavera
meals.instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. In a skillet, sauté garlic, bell peppers, and broccoli. Toss with cooked pasta and parmesan cheese before serving.

meals.title: Breakfast Quinoa Bowl
meals.instructions: Cook quinoa in a rice cooker. Top with scrambled eggs, spinach, and diced tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper.

meals.title: Chicken Fajitas
meals.instructions: Slice chicken and bell peppers, sauté in a skillet with taco seasoning. Serve in tortillas with toppings of choice.

meals.title: Crockpot Chili
meals.instructions: Combine ground turkey, canned tomatoes, black beans, and spices in a crockpot. Cook on low for 6-8 hours and serve hot.

meals.title: Egg & Veggie Scramble
meals.instructions: Scramble eggs with diced bell peppers and onions in a skillet. Serve with toast or tortillas.

meals.title: Asian Chicken Salad
meals.instructions: Toss shredded chicken with spinach, carrots, and a soy sauce dressing. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

meals.title: One-Pan Pasta
meals.instructions: Combine pasta, diced tomatoes, garlic, and water in a skillet. Cook until pasta is al dente and sauce thickens. Serve with parmesan.

meals.title: Chia Seed Pudding
meals.instructions: Combine chia seeds with almond milk and let sit overnight. Serve topped with fruit in the morning.

meals.title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
meals.instructions: Mix cooked rice, black beans, and spices. Stuff into halved bell peppers and bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.

meals.title: Chicken Stir-Fry
meals.instructions: Sauté sliced chicken with broccoli, carrots, and soy sauce in a skillet. Serve over rice or noodles.

meals.title: Overnight Oats
meals.instructions: Combine oats with yogurt and milk, add toppings of choice, and refrigerate overnight. Serve cold in the morning.

meals.title: Turkey & Bean Tacos
meals.instructions: Fill tortillas with a mixture of cooked ground turkey, black beans, and taco seasoning. Top with cheese and serve.

meals.title: Baked Chicken with Veggies
meals.instructions: Place chicken breasts and assorted vegetables in a dutch oven, drizzle with olive oil, season, and bake at 400°F for 30-40 minutes.

meals.title: Fruit Smoothie
meals.instructions: Blend together yogurt, banana, and spinach until smooth. Serve chilled for breakfast.

meals.title: Asian Noodle Salad
meals.instructions: Toss cooked noodles with shredded veggies, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

meals.title: Crockpot Chicken & Rice
meals.instructions: Combine chicken, rice, and chicken broth in a crockpot. Cook on low for 6-8 hours and serve hot.
